cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest today, then north-northwest Monday and north on Tuesday, moving across the southeast Gulf of Mexico toward the west-central Florida coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast (likely between Tampa Bay and the Big Bend)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Florida as of Advisory 9
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Florida as of Advisory 9
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Keys northward to the Big Bend is in the day-3 to day-5 cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are a 65% cumulative likelihood, with up to a 15% chance of hurricane-force (64-kt) winds by Thursday; sustained 40–60 mph with higher gusts possible in the bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Major hurricane approaching from the Gulf could drive 3–5+ ft of surge into Tampa Bay, especially with on-shore flow around Wednesday night/Thursday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with local 6 inch totals; risk of flash and urban flooding in the Tampa Bay area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous rip currents, possible tornadoes in outer rainbands, and significant disruptions to vessel traffic and cargo operations.
